Within minutes of our arrival at the lovely Registration building in the heart of the resort, we became even more anxious when it appeared that there was still more confusion over the precise type of accommodations we had secured through our auction bid. Fortunately, this initial problem was quickly resolved and from that point forward we encountered no other troublesome issues. The resort itself is a secure, gated community within minutes of everything Branson offers to the visitor. There are several types of accommodations available on the site ranging from fairly typical hotel type rooms, to condominiums, to cabins of various sizes. Our cabin was a two bedroom unit with a fireplace, a dining area, a well equipped kitchen (and a smaller kitchenette in the second bedroom), two very large baths with showers and large, garden-whirlpool tubs, a large living area with two leather couches and a comfortable overstuffed chair, and two large side and rear decks with seating and dining furnishings. The "master" bedroom was nicely furnished with a queen sized bed, a dresser, a television (there were three total in the cabin), end tables and a sitting bench. The second bedroom was more crowded with a small kitchenette (this bedroom and it's adjoining bath can be locked off from the rest of the cabin constituting a small studio unit, thus the kitchenette). Overall, the furnishings, and appliances (small kitchen appliances and a washer/dryer stack unit) were comparable to those found in other nice vacation condo units you may have visited. The cabin was quaint in appearance and nestled below the level of the drive approaching it, on a hillside with a small babbling brook running along it's border (one evening near sunset we watched two small red foxes playing around and in that brook). Guests may access a number of commons areas including a recreation room (including an exercise area), a business center, a large dining hall (where week-long stayers are offered one night of entertainment and a buffet for a small additional cost, well worth it), and a much too small room where a breakfast buffet may be purchased daily (this we skipped, preferring to prepare our own breakfast in our cabin). Outdoors, there are walking trails, basketball and shuffleboard courts, and pools (there is also an indoor pool). All requests for any sort of attention were met promptly and courteously during our stay. Our cabin provided us a very nice spot to relax, nap, read, and luxuriate (in the whrlpool bath!) when not doing the touristy stuff that is plentiful in the area. I will not review Branson itself since such reviews are ubiquitous and easily discovered by the curious. Based on our experience, I would recommend the resort, and in particular the cabins, with confidence to any who may desire such accommodations in the Branson/Ozarks area. My only caution would be that you may encounter some snafus with the previsit arrangements of your accommodations, as we did. Otherwise, we were well pleased and well served.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time”
Reviews.Author: Dianne046
Reviews.Content: The room was great, not anything like the pictures. Definately reccommend it. The lockout room for our guests was a great choice., provided more privacy. My only complaint is a teflon skillet should be available for the cooktop. Very nice and was furnished with granite and newer designed amenities, not country. Loved the litttle foxes playing.around. Beautiful country. A huge jacuzzi in the room. GREAT time and fellowship. Pretty convenient location also. Swimming pool is in the recreation building. Have to drive there.

Reviews.Title: “Not as promised or advertised.”
Reviews.Author: flyovermom
Reviews.Content: The deals made over the website and by phone weren't upheld. Should have known there'd be trouble when the 1st site was the front desk manager arguing w another customer.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul95320
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one room "suite" the first night and found it pretty small and unsatisfactory. Upgraded to a a one bedroom villa and it was absolutely great! Nice kitchen, whirlpool bath and separate shower. Breakfast buffet was ok but not great. Workout room ok. Would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “No Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Collegemom789
Reviews.Content: While staying in one of the cabins we had a clogged up bathroom sink and had to brush our teeth in the kitchen. The day we left the toilet overflowed and my daughter called the front desk. Monday morning I called the office and they said the manager would be in Tues. I called back tues and left a message and she has not returned my call. I will not stay there again nor reccommend it to anyone. WiFi costs $10.00

Reviews.Title: “OUR STAY WAS AS BAD AS IT COULD BE AND THEN IT GOT WORSE!”
Reviews.Author: kantrak
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and got very little sleep. The first night our neighbors were like Ma & Pa Kettle and all their kids. There's no sound proofing between rooms and they might as well have been in our room. They locked their keys in their car the next morning and all h*ll broke loose. Sleeping was impossible. There was no breakfast since it was out of season. We had to pay $10 a night for internet access. Access points were out of commission and access was sporadic. Only one person could use their laptop at a time. We asked to move to a different room the second night. At midnight I called the front desk because the people next door were having a major party and we were trying to sleep. Internet access was no better in the second room. If you like noisy rude people, not much sleep, no breakfast, and poor internet access, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Okie82
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days and it was amazing!!! I got a condo suite which was like a small apartment. Beautiful settings and service was great. They even have a pizza place on the grounds that delivers for free. Great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort and Entertainment all in One place”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunSeeker_2011
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful and surrounded by acres of woods. You can't belive you are still in Branson and close to everything while you are there. The Activities are excellent and affordable. What a great way for the whole family to have fun together. We are Cowboy Johnny Lonestar fans forever. He is a great entertainer and an instant friend. The pizza place has some great sub sandwiches at a good price and they will deliver right to your door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for spectacular rate”
Reviews.Author: mdoyle1411
Reviews.Content: We go to Silver Dollar City every year for the Christmas extravaganza to really kickoff our Christmas season. Our hotel is really just a place to sleep. At $39/night, I was a bit leary but had seen the location and it appeared to be clean and safe. We usually stay at a Fairfield for $69/night. This room was easily as nice and clean (a must for germaphobics like my wife and daughters). It was great to park outside of our room, loading and unloading was a snap. It was also great to see the other amenities were available (food service, game area, fitness facility). We're planning a trip in the summer and will definitely be looking to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Looks are Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: bdayna36
Reviews.Content: The place looks wonderful, check-in process took forever, only 1 person working the counter on a Saturday afternoon, makes no sense to me. We had 2 one-bedroom suites - they looked wonderful, but when they say the couch makes into a queen size bed? Maybe so, but the mattress was so thin you could feel every piece of metal in it. Then Sunday morning we were all taking showers - after only 2 showers the water was ice cold? And then when we told them about these issues all they could say was we are sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by the value.”
Reviews.Author: chiefan1
Reviews.Content: This was an short vacation trip to get the kids away before school, booked two rooms on the internet not knowing what we would get, just that the price was right. Very surprised when we arrived and found that this is a gated vacation community. Rooms were very clean and roomy. Location was quiet and within easy driving distance of everything there is to do in Branson. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie05206
Reviews.Content: Our Bonus Vacation through RCI at Westgate Branson Woods was an excellent choice. The staff was very courteous and accommodating and the property was well-maintained and decorated nicely for Christmas. Our only suggestion would be to clean the upholstery in the living room more carefully and to vacuum the bathroom air vents. We did notice in our two-story cabin on our last night's stay that another family must have checked in above us. It was a bit noisy from the children playing upstairs, but it was not so loud that we couldn't sleep comfortably. This is a beautiful property with lots of choices since it's close to the action of Branson, yet has some quiet country-like hiking trails and private cabin options.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar "Luxury" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FUBAR19
Reviews.Content: The resort is located on a beautiful property. The check-in process took forever. The suites are nice and spacious. The beds were rock hard and the breakfast buffet was definitely not worth $5 which is located in a hollowed out motel room. The outdoor pool looked really nice. Other than the gatekeepers, the service was horrible. The wifi costs $9. The worst part is that they required us to clean our room before we checked out. There was a list of things like emptying the garbages, cleaning the dishes and gathering the dirty towels. This makes me wonder if they even verify that the dishes were cleaned before the next people come, cause we found some pretty nasty looking dishes when we arrived. Who wants to have to clean up before they leave when they're on vacation? I've stayed at a lot of hotels and I've never heard of having to empty my own garbage into a dumpster before I leave or else I get charged for "extra cleaning". I gave this hotel 2 stars because it looks nice on the outside, but just doesn't have that extra to put it anywhere close to a place that can offer free wifi, free breakfast (or at least a better one), no cleaning at the end of your stay, a soft bed or even some hot chocalate to mix up yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion for 70+, overall it was acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Brandandie
Reviews.Content: We booked this facility for a July 2010 family reunion. My mom and aunts had been given a tour of this establishment a few months before, and were so impressed with the tour and the pricing, they booked it. Block of cabins were reserved for our family, and we all called in and held our reservations with a credit card. When we all arrived in Branson, check in was AWFUL. We all had to stand in line no less than 30 minutes to check in, get our keys, etc. Everyone staying at the resort had to go through this line. So off to a bad start. When we go to our reserved cabins, they were not what my mom and aunts had toured. They had been shown their top of the line, most recent condo's during the tour. These Condo's (called the Falls) are absolutely amazing, very luxurious, the beds are incredible, furnishings lovely... you get my drift. However, that is not where we were placed. Our cabins were older, not luxurious, by any stretch of the imagination. However, I thought they were fine. The difficult part about this was that part of our group was scattered around the resort. It seems that whoever booked 2 bedroom cabins were placed in the older models, and anyone that chose a 3 or 4 bedroom cabin were placed in the "falls" condos. Sooo, most every evening we would all congregate up to the Falls to meet and have dinner. You can also have Breakfast included in your stay, and they will supply you with vouchers, and then you go to a certain room where your breakfast is served. The breakfast was NOT good. First, the room that is designated for you to go for your breakfast buffet is simply not an adequate size to accomodate the amount of people that show up. The eggs didn't even seem real, it was just not appetizing. After the first day, none of us went back for breakfast the remaining 3 days. All in all, we still had a good time. However, upon making your reservations, I highly recommend that you request the "condos at the Falls", if you want to really enjoy your time there.

Reviews.Title: “Started off a little wrong but quickly became a wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: Tracey1223
Reviews.Content: When I booked this trip on line I called what I thought was the reservation desk at the resort to confirm all the details of our stay. We had booked a 2 bedroom 2 bath stand alone log cabin with fireplace. each bedroom had jacuzzi tub in it. When I called they confirmed this. Little did I know I was speaking to someone in Florida. Upon arrival they gave us a cabin number and directions. Get there and we have an odd numbered cabin and all the cabins are even numbered. Finally my14yr old son says Mom the door to our cabin is down here. In the basement under another cabin. Yes it was a log cabin but in the basement. Only one bedroom had a jacquzzi and there was no fireplace. I paid extra for the log cabin stand alone when I booked this. The excuse was that I didn't specifiy when I booked my reservation. I told them I even called the resort several times because I was trying to upgrade to a three bedroom cabin. The number I called was in florida. No notes were sent to them. It took them about 30 minutes to finish cleaning the other cabin and they made it right. The resort is extremely nice. The indoor pool, hot tubs, shuffle board, weight room etc. was great. My kids(my 14 yrs and my 25 yr old son and his wife) loved the place. They had there own suite seperate from my husband and I and the 14 yr old had the hide a bed in the living room. Cabin was great. Not perfect. They needed to do some little repairs like clean the furnace so that when you use it it doesn't set off the fire alarm, the carpet needed to be restretched in the great room had a crease in it in the hall way. All was clean and cozy. Kitchen very well set up. Even had a blender in it. Was very quiet and peaceful setting. excellent location from the strip close enough to get there easily and far enough to be away from the traffice and the noise. would highly recommend and we plan on going back next year. great family getaway or for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Most Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: RonGratehouse
Reviews.Content: We were blown away. The Resort was beautiful. The staff very nice and helpful. The rates amazingly affordable. We had to leave early because of the sudden death of our son. The staff helped everyway they could making our fast departure effortless. They are to be commended. When I Branson we will never stay anywhere else. We have already recommended Westgate Branson Woods to many of our close friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: DottieJeanP
Reviews.Content: We stayed a two bedroom condo. Our first impression was that it was in a great neighborhood like location. It felt like it was nestled in the woods. It was clean and well stocked with everything that we needed. My husband had a bad experience the first day. While taking a shower he accidentally bumped the spigot handle and he got scalded by the hot water. So, we called the front desk and they immediately sent a security/first aid personel to check on him. She was very friendly and efficient. He didn't require any medical treatment. My advice to the Resort is that they replace the facets in the shower to a more traditional one that doesn't extend out into the shower. Also, maybe they could install a little bigger shower so that you aren't hitting the walls with your elbows while trying to shower. We liked the lay out of the condo, we had complete privacy when we wanted it, from the other guests traveling with us. It was nice that we had a tv in each of the bedrooms. Overall, we really did enjoy our stay and if we needed anything someone was right there to help us. We have never been anyplace else where the people are so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: sjfuquatravel
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Westgate and thought it was a great deal for the money. I have to say first off though that the first two nights we stayed in the hotel rooms because the cabins were all booked up for the Labor Day weekend and they were terrible! I would not advise anyone to stay in the hotel rooms. Ours had a terrible mold/mildew smell that would knock you over and my allergies were terrible the first two days we were there. When I asked to be moved to a different room I was told that all the smoking rooms would smell like that because they were hardly ever used or cleaned. Maybe if you stayed in a non smoking hotel room it would be better, I don't know. The in room coffee tasted like dirt and the creamer was so old it was rock hard. There were several things wrong in the room such as non working lights, no iron, no tissues etc... Now for the great part... the cabin was awesome! They are beautiful, well cleaned and smell nice too. We felt like we were in a home instead of a room. We were given a two bedroom cabin when we switched for a one bedroom price because that was the first one available. The bedrooms both had a huge bathroom with jacuzzi's in them and they were situated on opposite sides of the cabin with closing doors for privacy. These would be great to share with another couple. The kitchens were well stocked with anything you could think of such as dishes, silverware, pots and pans, and even lots of gadgets you wouldn't think of. Off of the kitchen are sliding glass doors leading out to a huge deck with table and chairs. Our cabin was in the woods and it was so peaceful you wouldn't know that the busy Branson streets were just right outside the resort gates. The resort grounds are beautiful and the pool is nice and has two hot tubs as well. There is an activity center with something going on all the time and a pizza shop with great pizza and free delivery to your cabin or room. We would not hesitate to stay in the Westgate cabins again but just stay away from the hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Westgate Branson Woods met or exceeded every expectation.”
Reviews.Author: xtcher03
Reviews.Content: We wanted a condo with a full kitchen as close as possible to the Branson activities. With a security guard always at the entrance of the gated community, we felt safe and secure at all times. We walked the grounds every day, highlighted by the natural waterfall on the property. Everyone including guests and staff were friendly. A light went out in the bathroom and was replaced as soon as we called. Although we did not use the pools, restaurants, or other activities, they were available and appeared to be a pleasant experience for those taking part.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel ever and felt extremely safe the entire stay”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly3127
Reviews.Content: This was the best experience i have ever had with a hotel before.The price was amazing, beds were comfortable, and my kids enjoyed every minute of it. I would recommend this resort to anyone looking to get away for a while to relax or just experience something new. It is located just seconds from the main strip in Branson and great food just down the road. I will be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “After staying in scores of hotels and...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying in scores of hotels and resort facilities, we may have found the worst yet: Westgate Resorts in Branson. The "cabins" have paper thin walls, no parking, rude & drunk clientele, screaming children, food service who refuses to answer, unhelpful front desk.  Motel 6 is looking pretty good tonight.

Reviews.Title: “This place tends to overbook - beware.”
Reviews.Author: tmburns
Reviews.Content: I booked this through a time share exchange and this was my exchange for the year (not a free bonus week). The resort overbooked and did not HONOR their confirmation of my reservation which I booked two months in advance (similar to the poster below) through Interval International. I have a huge problem with organizations that do not HONOR their commitments out of what appears to be a financial desire even though they have already committed to provide you accomodations. That's bad customer service as well as unethical business practice. .

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Branson”
Reviews.Author: iamforauburn
Reviews.Content: Westgate Branson Woods was great. We stayed in a 2 bedroom cabin everything was great except the beds were very very firm/hard. We went to see Tony Roi (Elvis) which was great! Peter Pan ( great!) Noah ( unbelievable and breath taking) Shepards of the Hills (the family favorite) Mike Walker ( to funny) and 2 days in silver dollar city ( a blast). Our ages were 50 to 8 and everyone can't wait to go back! We thought the prices were affordable and Westgate had many discount tickets. Ate at Chester's the best hamburgers in town and resonable. All over it was a better vacation than our trip to Disney we will go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great for our large group”
Reviews.Author: ouduffs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a motel-like unit with about 20 units. There were about 15 families in our group so this was perfect. We parked just outside our room. The rooms were plain-jane but very clean. Having the refrigerator and microwave was handy for our week-long stay. The price was great, about half what we would have paid in a hotel there. With the gated entrance, we all felt secure. The grounds were beautiful and well-maintained and great for evening walks, bicycle rides, etc. The barbque area was used and was very nice. Would stay again. The only downside was no wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book your vacation here”
Reviews.Author: JDB123
Reviews.Content: Do not trust them. We booked a 2 br condo 2 months in advance. A lady called us to tell us 1 week before we were to arrive that they were downgrading us from a 2 bedroom condo to a queen motel room. This left us no time to book another place to stay. They gave us no explanation at all except that the resort was over-booked. The customer service rep was so rude. Not to mention that we had guaranteed our condo with a deposit... Horrible customer service. Terrible experience! Do yourself a favor and book with a different resort. BEWARE...

Reviews.Title: “Watch for Bait & Switch”
Reviews.Author: Carpe_Diem071
Reviews.Content: Family reunion with 10 rms for Emerald Pointe on lake. Less than 24 hrs, they over booked and moved us to Branson Woods not on lake. They did not care.

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Went”
Reviews.Author: EPB65
Reviews.Content: My family is from Connecticut and we traded our two Marriott Time shares through Interval for two units at the Westgate Branswood Woods. I went with my family of five (who stayed in one unit) and may parents and sister (who stayed in the other). In the end we were all very happy with the accomomadations and the resort. We stayed in the two bedroom condo units that were located in the pond and fountains area. The units were clean, spacious, and nicely decorated. They had a full kitchen and large dining area that was large enough for all eight of us. Both units also had a large screened in porch that overlooked the small ponds. The grounds were well kept and had flower beds all over the place. The outdoor pool area was fine, but it was often very crowded (It was very hot the week we were there) though there were plenty of chairs and lounges. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The one minor issue we had, they showed up within 10 minutes after making the call. Check-in also went well. We arrived early and they made every effort to get one unit ready for us as soon as they could. They also accomodated our request to be placed in the pond and fountain area. One thing that had me concerned before we arrived was reading through the reviews on this site. There were just as many excellent ratings as there were terrible and nearly the same amount of poor ratings as there were very good. In reading them it sounded like the reviews were for two different places. After going there I understand why. Like many resorts, this one offers different type of accomodations. There are the condos - which we stayed in, there are cabins, and there are hotel rooms (which more resemble motel rooms). As I mentioned, we were very happy with the condos. The motel rooms were small and dark - and we would have been extremely unhappy if we would have had to endure them for a week. I can't say much about the cabins. I did take a quick peek inside of some and they seemed to be a step below the condos and not as spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great...”
Reviews.Author: salemagnet28
Reviews.Content: I wasn't at all impressed. We went at the recommendation of a family member who stayed in the time share cabins. They loved it (but then, these are people that never have a negative thing to say about anything, never go anywhere, and their expectations aren't high to begin with, so there ya go). We stayed in building 1. I am not really a terribly picky person, but seriously: *The room slept four, but there were only enough towels for two guests *The beds were as hard as a rock. Unless you're into pain, this isn't exactly pleasant. *The room was superficially clean; a first glance in the bathroom shows cigarette burns on the faux marble counters from years past, and a sheen on the fixtures, but the first time you lay down a bathmat and get out of the tub, you realize how filthy the floor really is. *Speaking of the tub, if you're a bath person, you won't like this at all. The NARROWEST tub I ever sat in! I couldn't lay down with my shoulders at my sides, and I'm a NORMAL sized woman! *The toilet rocked back and forth.....annoying. *Gross, rust colored stains all over the 20+ year old wallpaper, water stains on the ceiling. *Drab, dated decor (I can overlook this as long as the room is clean, but it wasn't). *We chose to make our own bed and opt out of maid service for the two nights we were there, but when we requested fresh towels, we were told they were "out "of clean towels, and the staff couldn't have made less of an effort to offer us any options. We took it upon ourselves to walk to the pool for towels just so we could bathe. *Neither one of the bedside lamps worked. One single bulb on the opposite wall and whatever light came from the bathroom was all we had for reading after dark. *AC was loud, but, short of turning it off, was freezing cold. *NO REPRIEVE from noisy guests, who remained noisy very late into the night (But, considering that we couldn't sleep anyway because the mattresses were so friggin' hard, that was the least of our worries). * NO FREE WIFI, which stinks (it's available at an extra charge, but seriously, almost everyone else offers it as a courtesy)! The $5 breakfast buffet is awful, unless you dig canned fruit and Tang for breakfast. Coffee was lousy. Canned biscuits. Nothing at all was good about it. If it could be a cheap, processed version of a real thing, it was. The only thing that would be a PLUS for some is that it is very wheelchair friendly...... wide doorways and ramps from the parking lot make for easy access. Just don't expect any other perks! The price was not that bad, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms -- if you're in the right building!”
Reviews.Author: ATL_Georgian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westgate Branson Woods for a family reunion this past week. We had negotiated a special rate since there were 60 of us in total. This is a timeshare property, but they rent rooms like a hotel too. We had a 4 bedroom condo unit, shared with my parents and sister and her family. We were on the 4th floor of the 3200 building (very new, at the back of the property). It was absolutely awesome! It was actually 4 1-bedroom units that all opened up together. Each had a living area, a kitchen area, bedroom and bath. Also, the sofas in each living area open into a bed. That gave us a total of 8 beds in our 4 bedroom unit, all in their own room -- perfect for a group with several teenagers who want their privacy. Two of the four units had balconies and larger living areas which were wonderful. We had more space than we knew what to do with! The amenities (pools, shuffleboard, etc) are nice but nothing to write home about. Location is good -- just off the red route for easy access. Three cautionary notes -- 1) the check-in process can take a long time -- long lines from 2:00 to 4:00 most every day. 2) Some of my relatives were put in the cabins near the front of the property. They're OK, but not nearly as nice as the newer ones in the midrise buildings in the back. Once they saw our units they were disappointed in their own. -- Make sure to ask for the 3200 building. 3) Skip the breakfast! They have a buffet breakfast but it's in a tiny room with not nearly enough seats for everyone inside (and who wants to eat outside when it's 90 degrees!) and the food is mediocre at best. I will say that these shortcomings did not mar the stay for us at all. In the end, because of the wonderful rooms and good location, we felt like it was a wonderful stay and we would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Shelley N
Reviews.Content: Very nice place that is close to everything, yet set back out of the way away from all of the hussle and bussle. Liked the 24/7 security gate. Housekeeping service was excellent. Called the main desk and they said housekeeping was overwhelmed, but to just call and someone will bring whatever you need ASAP and they did indeed. When I went to check in they originally had us in a hotel suite (I think b/c I originally requested to be close to the main pool and these were the hotel rooms, but later switched my request to stay in the new building of condos), which is not what I payed for, but without asking they changed us to a condo in the new building. This resort is very convenient for large familes and groups as well as small. The main pool and playground area was great--the kids loved it. There is lots of room to BBQ with lots of sitting area to hang out and eat in. Did not try the pizza and did not do any kids activities, didn't have enough time. I would stay here again, but would like to try one of the cabins, but would stay in another condo room. The only reason I gave the rooms category a 4 and not a 5 is b/c the room didn't have a bathtub, just a shower, but was ok for us. The bed was very comfy. Everything was very clean. Ate breakfast here 1 morning, but wasn't real impressed, could upgrade this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: luvfun2
Reviews.Content: This was an RCI exchange. We were upgraded upon arrival to the newer timeshare buildings..3002 I think. The rooms were clean. Since we were in the timeshare building we didn't get maid service daily but that was OK. We had a little difficulty controlling the A/C. It was pretty cold..but better to be cool than warmer. We had two adjoining suites for our family: husband and daughter's family (grandson). There were 5 of us. The resort property is very large, but nice. Security gate 24/7. We wanted a central location for viewing Branson sites. It was easy to get from Resort location around Branson by following the color coded routes. Hotel staff were helpful in providing assistance w/Branson area.

Reviews.Title: “decent place, but terrible high pressure sales”
Reviews.Author: moreviews
Reviews.Content: I had heard about timeshare presentations, and my wife and I decided to try this one in exchange for tickets to a show. I travel alot with my job, and we have stayed in condos and hotels around the country. These are nothing special, and it currently is not finished. The decor and layout is a bit too utilitarian for me...not to mention it is just plain dated and in poor taiste like one of the shops in Branson exploded. It looked decent, and everyone was very nice going into it, but it was like a vampire movie...one where everyone seems so nice until you find out that you are whats for dinner...It was supposed to be only a 90 minute presenation, but 2 and a half hours later we were one of the first of our group to get out.. Basically, it was a nice salesperson, then bring in a closer, then a manager and keep us waiting after we had refused to make a decision before we left...and no one would sign us out so we could get our ticket vouchers and leave. We were honest and told our salesperson that we were just on a fact finding mission, but she only seemed to hear what she wanted too. I used to work for a major corporation so I know all the sales tricks, but these people are plain crazy, which reeks of desperation. I had no idea that people still employing such outdated sales methods any more. Furthermore, because we didnt buy our sales person said we were not going to be allowed on the premises again, and the we were going to be blackballed from their properties. Comon, anyone with money can stay there. We had our kids with us, or I would have went ballistic. I looked for the managers before we left, but of course they had disappeared, and after almost 3 hours I just wanted to get my kids out of there. We were considering buying, but we will not with this company. Was it just us, no the people that escaped with their vouchers just behind us, couldn't believe they were treated like they were either... their sales person also was .rude, beligerent, and talked to them like they were idiots. Save your money, go to Marriott or somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Great family get away”
Reviews.Author: KCr8rh8r
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Branson for the first time with reservations at another hotel. After two days there I felt like we were at a retirement home. We discovered Westgate Branson Woods and were able to find rooms. The room was great. Granite countertops, huge upscale master bath with rain shower and bigger than most apartments. Two 32" lcd tv's. The kids loved the activities and the inddor and outdoor pool. They are adding a huge indoor waterpark and spa soon which should make this an even better resort. It is close to the new Payne Stewart golf course, shopping, shows and the water so there is something for everyone. The location was great - 10 - 15 minutes from the landing which was our favorite place to hang out in the evenings if we didn't do a show. Overall a great experience and we stayed an extra night because of it. Very relaxing The only bad thing is sleeper sofa - don't try to sleep on it. They are good quality leather sofas but the mattress in the fold out part was not good at all. Bring a blow up mattress if you need additional space for the kids to sleep. Lucily we packed one. Overall it was a great weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customers-we love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: Bransontraveler712
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth or fifth time to stay at this resort. We are frequent visitors to Branson and have stayed in the regular motel -type rooms, and the one and two bedroom cabins. They are always clean and well-stocked. It's very nice to have the full kitchen and living area with the extra space that the cabins offer. On one occasion we came for a short trip over fall break and used the fireplace and enjoyed breakfast on the outdoor deck among the beautiful autumn colored trees. Our kids absolutely loved it, and still do. They are now teenagers and would be disappointed if we stayed anywhere else! The staff has always been friendly and helpful and the grounds and landscaping are beautiful. The location is pretty convenient to almost any attraction you might want to visit in Branson. Overall, we will return and have already recommended Westgate to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully maintained and comfortable accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: mjohns405
Reviews.Content: Spent our 33rd Anniversary here. Bought the package on an auction site so really didn't know what to expect. Read all reviews and it ran about 50/50 Love/Hate. On arrival we met the security staff who were very friendly and pointed out check in. Check in was immediate and we were in our room in a flash. "Motel 6" room but very comfortable and plenty of perks, coffee pot, fridge, microwave, fair tv. The resort is immaculetly maintain and rustic in nature. Plenty of options for fun at the resort with pools, jacuzzi, basketball courts, weightroom, business office with computers and printers. Daily activities available as well. Our fridge wasn't working right so made the call to maintainence and when we got back that afternoon it was working fine. I would and have recommended the resort to friends. Located so anywhere you need to go for shows is just minutes away. Had a great time and would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, changes could make it better.”
Reviews.Author: DGLions
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I along with a high school buddy of mine and his wife stayed at the resort last week. My Wife and I are Westgate owners so traded one of our weeks from Westgate Painted Mountain in Mesa for a week at this resort. It is a beautiful resort, very well maintained and nice clean rooms. We had a two bedroom two bath lockoff on the second floor. Room 3822 A nd B. The problem that we encountered was at check in, we were told to come back at 4 PM as it was the check in time. Not a problem as it was almost 3 PM when we arrived. When we went back at 4PM there was a long line, so obviously the clerk didn't tell us the truth. He was very rude the first time, so I made sure to get a different clerk to check us in. The second clerk was very nice, a more mature gent than the young man we intially talked with. After he checked us in one of the stafff led us to our GUIDE, Ha HA!!!! who would show us to our room and tell us about how everything worked in the unit and about events in the town. Guess what!!!!!! This was a bad attemept to try and get us into a Time Share presentation. I told this guy that we were already Westgate owners and traded ours in Mesa for this one. I also told him why would I want to buy another timeshare with the same company when I could trade. That did not satisfy him at all, he told me that Westgate was selling the company and that he would like to explain all of the changes, another attempt to keep to try and sell us a timeshare. My Wife and I already had received a letter saying that some of the resorts were being sold, but not ours in Mesa. That was the worst thing that we encountered at the resort. There was a pond behind our unit with large Bull Frogs and Ducks in it, nice to hear the Male Bull Frogs doing their mating calls at night after curfew, not annoying but really funny to hear and almost relaxing at times. We had there Pizza twice, fantastic to say the least. We did not eat the breakfast buffett as it was always very busy. We would eat our breakfast in town, the Plantation on Hwy 76 has a $4.99 buffet, which was much nicer in all respects, food was fresh and the staff was friendly at the Plantation. Over all Westgate Branson is a great place to stay, most of the staff are friendly, the maintence folks are great and if we needed anything they were right there to take care of us. The only two things that Westgate needs to do to make this a 5 star resort is, to screen their help or set up a customer service training program for their people at the front desk, not all of them but at least two that I could name but won't unless asked by Westgate headquarters in Florida. They also need to have a convient store that sells small items, like milk bread, beer, wine, etc. Overall is is a hidden gem, well kept, everything worked well in our unit, no bugs, lots of pillows on the beds, nice soft beds and the cleanliness is impeccable. We will definitely stay there again, but timeshare folks need to know that if you already own a unit in their system why annoy them.?

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful Resort! Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: bwelliver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westgate Branson Resort for three days. This is a gated community and you must check in at the gate. Seemed very secure which was nice. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. This resort offers standard motel rooms and cabins. This is a timeshare resort as well. Upon our arrival we check in at the main building which was spacious and very nice. Our check-in agent was just great and the check-in was fast and friendly. He told us everything we needed to know about the resort and gave us written information as well. We did arrive early and had to wait about one hour before check-in. We used the time to tour the grounds in our vehicle and look around. I would suggest you arrive near check-in time or be prepared to wait. We didn’t mind the wait at all and there is plenty to see at the resort. After check-in was completed you must meet with a timeshare representative for a few minutes. This is after all a timeshare resort so you have to expect that. We did not agree to take the tour due to time constraints but I wouldn’t mind if we return. The representative was pretty nice until we decided not to take the tour which seemed to upset her a little. They did offer show tickets and or a gift card which seemed like a good deal to me for 1 ½ hours of your time. Our room was a standard two queen motel room. There are several smaller motel buildings some single and some double level along with the cabins. We had a special internet deal to purchase two nights and get a third night free. I found this on their website along with some other deals. I booked the room online with ease and the cost for three nights was a total of under $110.00 which was unbelievable. Our room was very clean and well kept. There was a microwave and refrigerator in the room. The bed we slept on was quite comfortable and the room was overall very nice. We requested room service only one day we were there and they did an excellent job cleaning the room. The service is free in the motel section and I am not sure about the cabins. It was not luxurious but it was just fine for our needs. For the price we paid it was awesome to say the least! The grounds were immaculate and workers were everywhere up keeping the property. There is a large outdoor pool which was very nice and an indoor pool as well which was nice as well. The pools and fitness room are located in and near the clubhouse building. The fitness which I used was small but had enough equipment for a decent workout. There is also a sand volleyball court, basketball court, and shuffleboard court near the outside pool. They have scheduled activities at the clubhouse if you’re interested. There was not hotub/spa which I asked about and was told they will be installing a new one soon. There is always a pizza shop in the downstairs of the clubhouse with pools tables, ping pong tables, and other free games to play. We ate lunch at the pizza shop and the prices were good and the food was great! They will also deliver the food to your room if you wish. There are also outside picnic tables and grills you can use if you wish. Along with all that was a nature trail on the property. I walked the trail and you can get off at different locations so you can hike a distance you desire. I really enjoyed my walk. I walked the longest trail which seemed to be about two miles. Our experience overall was wonderful. We had a great time and the place was beautiful! Service was awesome and all the staff was very friendly. For the price I don’t think you could ask for anything more! We already planned a return trip for October!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints - Lovely unit”
Reviews.Author: New-2-AZ
Reviews.Content: We exchanged in to this resort and had a very positive experience. Check in went well and we were placed in a unit close to the indoor pool as we requested. The pool was clean and water temp was comfortable. Tues evening we attended a $9 buffet with program comprised of a dozen or so local performers presenting a brief introduction to their shows. The unit (3911 A/B) was very large, clean and nicely furnished. We enjoyed our week and would return here with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Ask to see your room first!”
Reviews.Author: kcdad
Reviews.Content: The outside was beautiful and well maintained as was the clubhouse. Upon arriving we were sold our room was not ready and to return later. When we did get to the room the ceilings were stained from roof leaks but otherwise acceptable. When they finally cleaned the room the next day (after 4pm) they only made one bed, didn't clean the coffee pot or provide more for the next morning and did not leave any fresh towels. While all the staff we dealt with were very friendly, a lot more attention to cleaning is needed for this to be a place people want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Branson!!”
Reviews.Author: OkieTravelerOklahoma
Reviews.Content: We stayed two weekend nights for a ridiculously low rate. The motel room was neat, clean and had quite a few extras--resort is in a beautiful setting just off the strip. The front desk and security personnel were extremely courteous and professional. I'll definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room for the money”
Reviews.Author: grykajos
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend at the Westgate Branson Woods. Check in was smooth. The room was huge and clean. We had a one bedroom condo which had two stories. The first floor had a living room with pullout bed, dining room and fully stocked kitchen. The upstairs had a bathroom with a huge jacuzzi tub, but no shower, and a bedroom with king size bed. The space was wonderful for two people. We didn't use any of the other amenities of hotel. Great if you are looking for a lot of room at great off season prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: aldlovetotravel
Reviews.Content: My parents own a timeshare here, so they booked us a room. We didn't have to attend a 90 minute timeshare session (only if we wanted too). The building we stayed in was built this year. Absolutely wonderful accommodations if you can be in those buildings. We had a kitchenette & separate living room. I love the rain shower.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrate the holidays in Branson”
Reviews.Author: JESSIEJO54
Reviews.Content: This was not my first trip to Branson, but this trip was so much fun and so relaxing I'm ready to go back. Needed a place for older, quieter people (we're all senior citizens) that would be close enough to events we wouldn't have far to drive. After checking out the internet I found a privately owned cabin (Mark and Sarah Mauzy) in the Westage Resort - Branson Woods. We were in Cabin 21 and it was so wonderful. It was hard to believe we were less than 5 - 10 minutes from all the major attractions. This 3-level cabin was perfect for us. Fully furnished, 3 bedrooms, 2 enclosed balconies, porch swing, log table and chairs and if you got up early enough in the morning you can greet the deer as they come up the trail. Also, we were the last cabin and it just made it that much better. We really enjoyed the musical we attended and Silver Dollar City was beautiful (even if you have to ride a scooter around like we did). A new attraction to us was the Butterfly Palace - a must see for the family. Food was great at the dinner and the Sons of the Pioneers were part of the performers. Wonderful. Can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: jaims0982
Reviews.Content: We got our cabin cheeper than we usually do for a hotel room. We go to Branson at least twice a year but usually more than that. Our Cabin was soooo clean. There was two little ladies that came every morning to give us more towels and get our trash. Everyone was very nice. It was quiet and just what we needed to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TaresaE
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a very relaxing weekend at Westgate Branson Woods. Excellent location just minutes from the main strip area and one of the outlet malls where we found excellent sales and friendly people too. We arrived late Friday night, and I was initially concerned we would have problems checking in but this was not the case. It is a gated community which I liked too. Before this trip I was pretty determined that Branson would NOT be a regular vacation fro me and my family but EVERYTHING this weekened was wonderful and I am sure we will return. P.S. we did buy a timeshare with Westgate and after reading some of the posts I am a little concerned. However we did have a GREAT experience this past time so hopefully it will be ok.

Reviews.Title: “Westgate Branson Woods Resort”
Reviews.Author: dancewithtina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Branson Woods Resort for a fantastic price and in return we had to listen to an hour and half presentation of their time share resort. The rooms they put you in are equivilant to a Super 8 Motel. You get to see the "GOOD" accomadations during the presentation. All in all it was good. We weren't in the room that much anyway. The presentation of the resort was not high pressure at all and the presenters were so nice and fun to talk with. Highly unusually for that type of set up. The resort is beautiful and very close to all the shows and restaurants. We did not buy the time share and were still treated very nice. I recommend this resort package to anyone that hasn't tried it before. If we were 20 years younger I'm sure we would have taken advantage of the offer because as you refuse the 1st offer, they continue to offer you lower and lower cost deals, Hold out until the end and it's very affordable. TB/Texas

Reviews.Title: “A great deal!”
Reviews.Author: csa4470
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week at Branson Woods with my brother & his family which included 2 kids, ages 9 & 12, & an infant. The resort had beautiful landscaping & was well maintained. Checking in was quick, less than 10 minutes. I asked for an upgrade to a 2 BD, 2BA cabin from the 2BD, 2BA villa that I had reserved thru' Endless Vacation Rentals. I was graciously given the upgrade at no extra cost. The cabin was very clean & spacious. Everything worked except the DVD player which was promptly replaced when we called about it. One night there was a problem with ants in one of the bathrooms due to the torrential rains they had for 5 days in a row. Maintenance was called & someone was there in less than 15 minutes to spray & get rid of the ants. This had nothing to do with cleanliness, just the ants looking for a dry place because of all the rains the area had experienced over the past week. The indoor pool was very clean & heated & the kids really took advvantage of that! I was a little disappointed that the hot tub was not in operation & didn't look like it had been for some time as it was empty & there were leaves in thebottom of it. We ordered pizza from the resort one night & it was very good & well-priced. We also saw the free magic show in one of the pavilions. The best free show I have ever seen. We also went to the $5 breakfast buffet twice. It was a good value. The staff there were very friendly & the food was good. We had a great time at Branson Woods & would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “surprised”
Reviews.Author: corvette70
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a cabin which was nice. My only problem was the fact that I was required to pay for the entire stay upon check in. I have never had to do that before at any hotel and when I informed the desk clerk that I stayed there in July and wasn't asked to pay first, the clerk told me I was lying. I had the money it was the principle of the situation. I have to wonder if the reason was because I am African American and wearing a baseball cap. I may have looked a little rough around the edges because I had been driving and had worked all night. They had my credit card on file. I just wonder why I had to pay first.

Reviews.Title: “The condo was alot like camping bugs and all...”
Reviews.Author: kgd3887
Reviews.Content: My family and I looked so forward to our trip to Branson this year. The pic of the condo we were to stay at was quite different from the one shown on the website. When we arrived and started to check in another couple was really yelling and complaining about how dirty their room was... My husband and I chuckled and said to the desk clerk can't make everyone happy can you? Boy did we eat those words. The grounds for Branson Westgate off Roark Valley Road are beautiful to look at. There are things that need to be takin care of like the gate at the smaller pool dragged and the fencing screws were out of concrete(what's the purpose of the fence if not properly secured?), the pools are painted on the bottom but dosen't look like they did it this year. And, because they didn't, the chippy peel look makes it look dirtier than it was. We really enjoyed the dinner and entertainment that was provided for a small fee. Ok, what I have been dreading to share... Our condo was cute until we opened the door... It was dark, dirty and buggy. I immediately began to clean the room with lysol wipes and spray. Towels looked and smelled fresh. Bedding was a bit stained and again buggy. We would literally have to brush the beds out at night before retiring. We were in a two bedroom w/ two bath unit. Bugs seem to come out at night when the lights went out... Kitchen counters had been painted I guess, they were chipped, stained and had burnt rings from hot pans sitting on them. Needless to say the wipes I used were grey to black in color after wiping things down. The kitchen table was sticky and left water marks if you set something with moisture on it. The door track for slider was full of dead bugs, I don't even know how it opened and closed properly. Furniture in bedrooms was beat up a bit and doors did not properly work on closet or TV stands. My husband kept saying it is ok, lets just make the best of it and my daughter and I were upset. The toddler's feet were filthy, (BLACK) after just being on the floor for a little bit of time. We just were not able to really relax because we had to make sure we had shoes on and constantly shake our things out before wearing or going to bed. I didn't complain but I did tell the front desk three times about the bugs. I wanted to make sure it would be cleaned and sprayed for the next guest. Some other things that need tended to were the dumpster doors where you take your trash were hanging off the hinges. The hot tub wasn't even filled or working and it was full of dead bugs as well. There is no game room per say, it is foosball and pingpong that you have to pay for. No arcade things like pinball machines. The resturaunt on site has very good food. Eating area comes across unclean due to the stains on the carpet. It is a big resort area, again the grounds are beautiful to look at but no sidewalks to walk on and not many people drive the 20 MPH that is posted so it was a bit dangerous to be walking around at times. Especially with children. We also bought tickets from the office and found them to be cheaper w/coupons at the places we went to like The Ducks and Mosco Circus. They don't promote all shows and to be honest we probably enjoyed the ones they didn't promote the best. THE MIKE WALKER SHOW IS FANTASTIC! They also kept calling for us to go on a property tour and trying to give us free tickets and lunches.. To be honest we felt we had seen enough... Our trip to Branson was great, the place we chose to stay was a bit disappointing. I know that not every one will get a yucky condo to stay in, but just be aware that they are out there.

Reviews.Title: “Was just what we wanted...”
Reviews.Author: Glam82
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 5 pm on a Saturday to check in, only waited for about 2 minutes in line, and were promptly checked in. We got our welcome packet from the front desk, and went straight to our studio room in one of the "cabins." We booked this through ICE Rewards, which is a benefit from our timeshare that we purchased in Mexico. After reading the reviews, I wasn't quite sure what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a kitchenette, which came with dishes, dish soap, sponge and a place to dry them in. Also had a toaster, microwave, a juicer, a wine opener, can opener, etc. We shopped at the Country Mart nearby for the week, since we didn't want to go out all the time. Each morning staff members would come by to see if we needed more towels, trash bags, etc. Most mornings we didn't need anything, since the room came well stocked with towels and the like. They have a roller vacuum in the room, so we kept our room clean while we were there. I loved the way that we weren't bothered at all, we felt secluded and it was easy to relax there. The walls are pretty thin, but we brought a fan with us, and that helped out tremendously. We also had very quiet neighbors. We went to the pool one day, and my daughter loved it. They have lots of grills up by the pool area, and there's a lot more going on there that we didn't take advantage of...we spent most of our time at the lake and off the resort. We were NOT harassed to watch any timeshare presentation. I don't even remember it being mentioned. And if we needed anything, there was a number to dial from our phone and they would bring it to your room. When we go back, we will definitely stay at Branson Woods again. It was a great vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerously Filthy Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Wes_69
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with this Hotel through Orbitz. The room was Firthy Dirty with Rocks,grass and a big black stain on the Floor. The room had a teribble odor and their was SPIDERS AND COB WEBS above the window as well as around the air conditioner we took pictures. I could not get an immediate refund because Orbitz had a mamimum of 5 days for a refund so I was stuck 5 hrs from home with no money for a Hotel because i had used it for this one and I had 5 people I had to find a room for or turn around and drive another 5 hrs home. When I cancelled my reservation and went to turn the keys in the staff never spoke one word to me or even apologize for the mess. The staff didn't seem to care at all. I would not recommend this Hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Yearly family vacation”
Reviews.Author: texasmom1
Reviews.Content: We have family from all over the US come together once a year and this year we enjoyed our time together at the Woods. The resort is nice. Lots of activities to enjoy. The pool was very crowded with little children, but when you have Table Rock Lake right there, who needs the pool? We stayed in building 42 and had 2- two bedroom units. The units were huge, and pretty clean. They have their own washer and dryer and a screened in porch that overlooked a pond, fountain, fish and ducks, which was great because we could sit outside without getting bit. The kitchen was workable and the dining room was big enough to sit us all with the use of some chairs from the deck etc. There is free parking for boats. The deli serves great pizza and there are b-b-que's outside of the indoor pool. Outdoor activities inlcuded basketball, volleyball, shuffle board. There is also a very large hill that you have to drive up to the resort and that provided some muscle aches for all. We were pleasantly surprised with the sq/ft. of the units as we were mostly adults with big teenagers and did not feel cramped. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Always Awesome”
Reviews.Author: emmylou34
Reviews.Content: As always our stay here was wonderful! Our Cabin was very nice/clean. And the staff is always helpful and curteous.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmsre”
Reviews.Author: roshea4u
Reviews.Content: My family and decided to take the 4 day 3 night $99 stay at the Branson Woods, OMG talk about nightmare. Ist of all I spoke ith a rep from the resort before we visited the resort and told her about al the bad reveiws I had read about the resort, she assured me that all of their facilities were up to par, and that the room that my family and I would be staying in, is part of what the saleperson would be tying to sell us. My husband and our two kids stayed in a rinky-dink motel room in building #5 room 527, 1st of all when we arrived to our room the 1st thing we noticed that the door to our room looked like someone had to break in the room, the door was all bent, and the paint was scratched. but the worst part was when we opened the door, I'm talking about cheap, the wall paper was peeling, there was about a 5 inch draft under our door, you could practically look outside, the bathroom was just plain ridicoulous, I mean it had an old nasty plunger beside the toilet, there was no trash can or disposal in the bathroom. Four days at this resort not one person showed to clean the room, bring us towels, empty the trash, each time we had to request towels and trash bags. One morning about 7:30 i heard a loud bang on the door, I hurridly put on some clothes and went to the door, I saw no one, but someone had put two rolls of toilet paper outside our door. Then to make things even worse, we went to our 90 minute tour of the resort, this black lady was so nice in the beginning, but after telling four different people we we're not going buy into this deal with an 18.77% interest rate, she became very irritable, and acted as though we had did her an injustice, her whole demeaner changed after we said no for the last time. She pretty much walked away, and said someone would be with us to check us out. The property was beautiful from an outer appearance, and very convenient as it relates to the outlets and shows, but I wouldn't recommend this Resort to my worst enemy...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4 bedroom cabin, great price.”
Reviews.Author: EvyDel
Reviews.Content: We had cabin 10 and from the reviews expected very little. WOW were we surprised. The cabin had newer appliances, 2 swings on the screened in porch, and decorated with inexpensive but had all the flavor of branson decorations. The dishes were all new, the counters without chips, the beds king size, and the towels thick white and fluffy. 6 TV's. The ONLY complaint was the rugs, they were pretty dirty, and we kept our shoes on, I don't know why the rugs are so dirty, they didn't look that dirty, but the kids socks turned black.We paid about 275 a night, for 4 families to stay VERY comfortably,with lots of room, almost 2400 feet. The grounds were gorgeous, pools,staff, landscaping,were the very best. I really believe all the bad reviews came from people,who took part in the timeshare presentations, and stayed in the motels on the grounds.I can't comment on that part, but if you want a 2,3,4 bedroom cabin, they are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to give it a five star but...”
Reviews.Author: flutepilot
Reviews.Content: First of all, this property is beautiful and located in a lovely area. It is full of woods and hills. The property is constantly being maintained, at least on the outside. Gardners, mowers, trimmers, trash pickup, etc are going on constantly. Your car has to be a great hill climber, however, if you are in some of the cabins. To get out of the valley where we were took a mountain goat, with one hill exceeding 30 degrees upslope...but I digress. The rooms are spacious; the suites, which we were in, have a full kitchen, dishwasher and washer/dryer - very handy with an 18-month old. They were very clean, but had some problems. The TV in the main part of the suite would not go above channel 18 for some reason. The other two worked fine. The toilet paper holder in the small side room (similar to a hotel room, and could be locked off) literally fell off of the wall. Maintenance tried to repair it but, as it had been improperly repaired at least two times before, he simply made things worse to the point that an entire section of wallboard will have to be cut out and replaced. There was a large area of peeling paint above the fiberglass tub enclosure and one unpainted area above the toilet - a streak about a foot long which the painters just didn't do(!). We were in a lower unit, and the ceiling (floor) between us and the upper is quite thin. Any activity came right through, and the upstairs guests ran their washing machine at 11:00 P.M., which kept us awake as it was very loud. Now to the real problems. Most, if not all modern hotels have wi-fi or a hookup for free and many have a computer or two for guest use. This property charges quite a bit for wi-fi, and has two computers which you must pay to use. In addition, in a property with a total capacity in excess of 1800 guests, they only have three treadmills and one eliptical machine in the fitness center. Four swimming pools but only those few machines for over 1800 people? The on-site breakfast was very much the same as those offered for free at any good hotel today but they also charged for this. To sum this up, I found the property to be a dichotomy of excellent and somewhat questionable. As I said, I wanted to give it five stars, but just could not due to the reasons stated.

Reviews.Title: “Puke”
Reviews.Author: holbear46
Reviews.Content: Filthy, filthy, filthy room. Very cheaply built motel room. Housekeeping was a JOKE. We stayed six nights. Every single day something went wrong. No coffee in our room (but we had a coffeemaker), no bath mat, no replacement of disposable cups, blankets had holes, table not cleaned where we ate in our room, carpeting filthy (our feet got dirty after walking on them AFTER our showers), etc., etc., etc. We bought a timeshare, though, hoping the condos are clean and the other travel sites are clean. If not, we will throw one heck of a fit. Hope we didn't make a huge, costly mistake buying into the timeshare. Guess we'll find out. I know how to make a "stink" when service is lousy.

Reviews.Title: “Who wouldn't stay here ????”
Reviews.Author: mrgoalie
Reviews.Content: Wow...850 sq ft, full kitchen, easy chairs, sofa, cable TV with 60+ channels, DVD player great and helpful staff, jacuzzi tub, 2 minutes from the Branson strip, comfortable surroundings, and the best part $75 per night and spotlessly clean. No complaints from us. Anyone with complaints must be very unhappy people. Next time we head back to Branson, we will be here !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WESTGATE! NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: finedezine
Reviews.Content: I own a timeshare and it's through westgate, i booked for 4 days at westgate branson woods and i had 5 other people with me it was a nightmare to say the least all though i own property on table rock lake at westgate emerald point i can tell you right now i am ready to sell and get out of their way because they have the worst accomidations and the worst hospitality you can imagine! anyways i booked for 4 days and i got a 2 bedroom with jet tub and fireplace with a screen in porch, the screen in porch was a mess the doors were kicked in and the porch smelled that of smoke, i would not recomend this place to anyone looking to have a good time on a vacation or otherwise as to their guest services they are not friendly people and just want you to buy into a property and if you dont and you deny them that satisfaction well sorry about your luck they would rather see you kick rocks then to see you again, anyways if you want to have a great time i would recoment a hotel on the landing i bet you wont regret it...

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: swaybailey
Reviews.Content: This was a terrible experience. I was on the computer for three days picking out the place we would stay on our Spring break trip. We chose this place because of the price, (of course), the fact that it had a bedroom that shut off from the living room, the jetted tub, fireplace and washer and dryer. We doubled checked on our reservations, we booked straight through them, so we thought we were a go! We arrived around 6p.m. ready to put our stuff down and go and grab a bite to eat. At the front desk after much searching they finally told us that they had overbooked and that they had put us in a inn down the road. No ammenities, The room was just being cleaned and the place was dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay ~ Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Jrprez
Reviews.Content: We own a timeshare with Westgate and were very happy with this resort. Very cute "cabins" and nice pools. Only drawback for me, was that there's no free internet, but it is available at an additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Motel”
Reviews.Author: MissouriMomOf6Kids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were completely disapointed when we walked into our room because it was NOTHING like the pictures we saw online. The pictures showed a rustic nice hotel. Our room was nothing more than a cheap motel. It was not at all rutic, it was tiny and it was noisey. Upon arrival we were excited, the main building where you check in was more than we expected, but then sent us away from the main building to building #5, where our room was in the back and opened to the outside. The outside had a "logcabin" look, but that was all the rustic there was to our room. The room was clean, that's the best I can say for it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bajamiller
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was nervous about staying at the Westgate after reading some scary reviews here. My husband and I arrived on October 10. We booked through a timeshare promotion. For $79, we got 2 nights stay, 2 Silver Dollar City tickets, coupon book, and $60 gift certificate for dinner! We were also very nervous to sit through the presentation, we had done one once before a few years back, and were treated like second class citizens. That is putting it nicely. More on this later. Okay, we had to check in at a welcome center to receive our tickets, and certificates for dinner and other things. The ladies were very nice, and efficient. We were off to a great start! Arriving at Westgate was great. The property is beautiful. They have the cutest cabins! You'll see those as you drive to the main office. We passed the motels we would be staying in. They were cute as well! From an outside view, I was happy with what I saw. Check in was a breeze! The guy was very nice, and we were out in about 10 min. tops! And this was at about 4:30. So you would think they would be a little busy, because check in starts at 4:00. Everyone in the lobby was being handled quickly. So far so good! We were staying in building 7. Our room was clean. Plenty of towles, little soaps and shampoos. We did prefer a king, but I forgot to mention it. So we got 2 queens. That's okay no biggie. For 79$ for our entire trip, we were very pleased!. All the fixtures in the bathroom were shiny. Floors were as clean as to be expected. Large fluffy pillows, and the bed was comfortable enough. The room also had cable. We loved that because we like to watch tv right before we sleep. The room had a hair dryer, coffee maker, iron and ironing board, and the most useful things were a microwave and fridge! We like to bring juices, sodas, sandwiches, and snacks with us on long trips. We are from Independence, MO so we like to travel prepared. It was sooo convenient to be able to transfer our food to the fridge on arrival. The rest of our trip was great, I won't go into our visits to area attractions. We had to do our timeshare tour on the last day. We were DREADING it!! TO our surprise our sales person was VERY good! Treated us like normal human beings. Wonderful to talk to! We were not going to buy that day, but we did purchase a vacation at a deeply discounted rate. Not bad! No high pressure here! We were out in a little less than 2 hours. Wonderful. I know that there are probably some sales people there that are jerks, but ours was awesome. Dan was his name. We did not utilize the indoor swimming pool, or breakfast. So I cannot offer any opinions on that. All in all we had a great weekend for the money! Very pleased. If you book through a timeshare, you will be staying in the motel part. It was clean. Had everything we needed. Also, the maid service was excellent. When we returned from Silver Dollar City our beds were perfect, all soaps were replaced. All towels were replaced. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Fall stay at Westgate Branson Woods”
Reviews.Author: Jane1243
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Woods several other times. It has been several years since we last stayed. The rooms are in need of refurbishing. The staff needs to attend a workshop on customer satisfaction. What used to be a complimentary breakfast is now charged a flat fee for. We were disappointed in the accomodations. I reserved a room with a king bed and we were given a room with two "queen" beds. They were not true queen size. Just a standard size a bit longer. The room had a chemical smell from the cleaning agent used. So while we got the non-smoking room we requested we were overcome with the smell of chemicals. The water pressure was terrible. Probably our last stay at The Woods.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms; great service; no complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: BransonVisitor
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week end at the Westgate Branson Woods. The greeters in the Welcome Center were exceptionallly nice and helpful. Taking their advice helped us avoid future traffic and shopping problems as we manovered through the city. The hotel was very nice and the breakfast service was adequate for our needs. Our grandchildren stayed next door and enjoyed the swimming pools. We stayed just across the road from the outdoor pool and had access to all amenities in close walking distance. The tour and sales presentation lasted a little longer than the stated 1 1/2 hours, but our sales rep was congenial and signed us off without arguement, after about 10 tries to get us to buy. He finally saw that we REALLY, REALLY couldn't afford that lifestyle. Overall I would say the weekend away with the grands was worth the 2 hours of sales pitch. Besides, we knew when we went that we would not buy, so no biggie! We're just thankful we had very clean rooms that smelled good and were cooled well on a very HOT weekend. We would definitely do it again (in a few years) ;-) But not any time soon. We would recommend it to our closest friends, but tell them to make up their minds before the sales pitch begins.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience I have Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: chelebella
Reviews.Content: For the first time in my life, I decided to give one of those "3 day, two night for $99" a try. I knew this property was a timeshare and was interested to go there, experience the timeshare vacation lifestyle and see if it was for me. Instead of the Villa promised in the literature, what greeted me (after the hourlong trip up the main drag in Branson and rude "welcome" staff) was one of the worst motel-like rooms I have ever stayed in (and that includes the unfortunate time I stayed at a "hooker" motel off the Vegas strip due to an emergency that forced an extra night's stay during peak travel times). The bed offered no blanket, only a sheet and grimy bedspread. The shower had no pressure and was marred with cigarette stains, the molding all around was falling off and encrusted with grime. There was no cover on the light overhead in the bath, no tissues, and a plunger sat ready for the frequently filling up toliet. The air unit had two speeds that worked...off or on. It ran constantly if on and we were either freezing or hot. We tried to order a pizza one night and were told that they had no dough (at 7PM) because the management had been "forced" to give away free pizzas after some major screwup upset some of the timeshare owners. Nice. The walls were paper thin, we heard everything happening in the rooms on both sides of ours as well as above us. The pool was ok. Small and crowded though. We were never more than a foot away from others. The timeshare demo was awful. After being told that "sometimes timeshares just aren't right for everyone and if it's not for you, that's ok," I felt relieved and looked forward to learning more. At the end of the demo, however, when I explained why I was less than thrilled with my overall Wetsgate experience, the salesman was abusive, rude and made it clear that it was not ok at all to tell them no (this after we'd suffered through over 2 hours of presentation that was supposed to have been only 90 minutes.) He raced my family back to the sales "pen", said several more nasty things (in front of my six year old daughter, I might add) and said we had to wait to talk to "corporate" before we could go. Then we sat and sat, and sat and sat, watching as the sales rep went and spoke to someone, and pointed at us. After about 45 minutes, it became clear no one was coming, and honestly, we figured if they did, all we had to look forward to was more shabby treatment and nasty words in front of my now very upset child. So, we left. Now I worry that my credit card will be charged since we didn't get signed out. If it does, I plan to fight it tooth and nail. I have never felt so ripped off, or badly treated by a resort. Initially, I thought a westgate vavaction home might be a good idea for my family, but now? I'd never go back to any property these people own.

Reviews.Title: “I agree...It was Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: chanceyblu
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with others...it was definetely not a 3 star or a 5 star as their billboard boasts. Maybe if you are a owner the accomadations are much better but when I think of a 3 star hotel this is not what comes to mind. I have stayed in other 3 stars that earned their rating. Mind you...we don't have kids, so didn't do any pool time or activities which probably would make it rate a little higher too. I can only speak to our room. It was just your average hotel room...nothing 3 star about it. The fridge and microwave were nice but have had that in lower star rooms as well. They never cleaned the coffee maker in between uses. Never vacuumed that we could tell. We did get new towels and our beds made but had to ask once during the week to have the bedding changed. We were there for 7 nights. We did not see bugs like others said thank goodness. The staff were very nice however and the gate guys were so friendly and informative. Very appreciated! Will we stay there next year...no.

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic!”
Reviews.Author: 80space
Reviews.Content: I know what you’re thinking, how bad could it be? I thought the same thing. 1.5 hours to check in. Room is average at best. 3.5 hours for a sales presentation filled with "Car Salesman" tactics like writing down the price on piece of paper and having three salesman circle through your table before you can leave. If you like buying a new car then you may like this environment. People need to listen to Dave Ramsey before they sign up on a timeshare. Hey, I am going to spend 30k over my lifetime on coffee, but Starbucks doesn't want me to pay all of that up front. Look up Time Value of Money and stay away from this place.
