However, they are more than willing to finance your 33k-48k at 18.99%. Get a brain people!!!! More than happy to pay and stay at Chateau on the Lake rather than waste your time here. If I still haven't convinced you, avoid the so called Breakfast bar unless you like flies and grease.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: maryy
Reviews.Content: I can only speak to my family's vaction to Branson woods. I read some of the bad reviews listed here before we went to I was a bit worriedl. HOWEVER, I have to say we found it all to be wonderful. We did have to wait in a line to check in, but it wasn't terribly long. I think many people thought they had to be there by 4pm and really you had until 9 oclock to check in. I really don't think the actual process of checking in took that long, there was just alot of folk there. Once in our rooms (we had 3), we found them very nice. It was a hotel room, fridge, microwave. And we had adjoining rooms, nice touch. The swimming pools were very clean and very nice. Loved the largest pool!! Lots of chairs around them as well. Included in our 99 dollar package were two free ticktes to silver dollar city!!! Our second day there was our timeshare presentation. Very impressive!! The condo they showed us was lovely! We were slightly interested in a timeshare, so they did work hard to sell us however, they were not pushy. Infact when we did finally say no, they were great about it. They said they did not want us to do anything we didn't want to do. they were very kind. I did not feel pressure at all. Case, and Zach were great. I have to say over all it was great. And all employees (even the security guards) were very friendly!! So much to do you really could just stay on the resort! And the ice cream and pizza shops right there are opening this week!! We will return!!! Very family friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “2 Thumbs Down For Service”
Reviews.Author: adchristian
Reviews.Content: The cabin we stayed in last weekend was not a winner overall. Our first impression was that upon checking in promptly at 4pm we were forced to stand in a line with about 30 other people for well over 45 minutes. Then we were told the room was not ready and we should take a seat. All this time we had 2 carfulls of kids in 95 degree heat after 3 hours of driving. After another hour, we got our keys. The cabin itself was comfortable and spacious, but the carpets were so filthy that the kids had black feet. The main pool was a welcome sight - though we stayed in the deep end because of a loudmouthed family who was taking up most of the shallow end with a "water football" game and a few too many beers. For the price paid for 3 nights, you could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty Cabins, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: RobertELeeMo
Reviews.Content: It took us almost one hour of waiting in line to check in when we arrived. The front desk people acted as if this was a normal condition, but almost everyone in line was mad - some even left.. We arrived early and were told to come back at 4PM. We did that and waited 30 minutes to get to the front of the line to be told to wait again as our 4 bedroom cabin wasn't ready yet. Finally at about 5PM we received the keys. The floors in the kitchen were just about as dirty as could be, as were the carpets. Our kids' feet were black. When I wiped a spot off the kitchen floor the whole towel was black with dirt. When I checked out I was told that my comment would be passed on to the housekeeping staff - Well, obviously they are the problem - and the front desk guy had obviously heard it before.. I would never consider returning to this place. The breakfast area - $4.50 a head - was crowded and the food about the same as a low-end motel's free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy motel”
Reviews.Author: reynolk
Reviews.Content: Wife and I decided to visit Branson after hearing nothing but good things about the city, upon arriving at Westgate and walking into our motel room we were disgusted, bugs everywhere, and the smell of mold and mildew in the room was terrible. The carpet was filthy, and big cockroaches came out at night. The room was so nasty that after the second night my wife and I decided to cut the stay short and return home at 4:00 in the morning. How can this be rated a five star resort, it was more like a cheap hourly motel.

Reviews.Title: “Acquired a MRSA infection and would never go back!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: milldigg
Reviews.Content: Initial impression at check in was good. Once we checked into our timeshare trade-in property impression was another. An old bent screen door that you had to lift to open was our first impression. The wallpaper was torn in the kitchen, counters had multiple burn spots on them. There was an old juice box in the sleeper sofa, the additional bathroom was very dirty. This was spring break and they were only at minimal capacity. Why were they so dirty? The hot tub was luke warm and the lid was torn and old. Unfortunately, this was something we could not see at night. After a severe MRSA infection to my face and $2000.00 worth of medical expenses(all of which were denied by them) we came home early. I would not return to this or any other Westgate Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible construction noise / smell”
Reviews.Author: tired_m0m
Reviews.Content: We arrived at our Cabin at Westgate on Monday, June 30th. We were woke up at approximately 7:30 Tuesday morning, and every morning after, with construction (going on right behind our cabin) and the smell of asphalt (they were paving a road). That evening I went to speak to the front desk but was told I would have to speak to a Manager and the Manager was not currently in. I returned Wednesday but was told the Manager was at lunch. The front desk person took my name and phone number and advised me I would receive a call. I did not receive the call. I checked out of the resort on Thursday, July 3 around 10am. I again tried to speak with a Manager and was told she was in a meeting. I tried to discuss my concerns with the cabin and the gentleman at the front desk said "Let me guess - the construction noise?." I was offered $20 off per night but I did not feel that was sufficient. The gentlemen took my name and number again and advised me I would receive a call do discuss my concerns. It is now July 7th and I have not received a call regarding my complaint. The reason I rented this cabin was for the quiet surroundings and wonderful screened in back porch facing the woods - perfect for morning coffee. If I was looking for noise, I could have rented a cheaper hotel room and been just as happy. I was dissatisfied by my stay, however I am more dissatisfied with the lack of response from Management regarding my concerns. If this gets resolved I will stay there again, however I will know to make sure my cabin is on the other side of the resort - away from the construction. We stayed in a two bedroom cabin (# 166) - which really was wonderful had it not been for the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, no more, no less”
Reviews.Author: readittoday
Reviews.Content: This property is owned by Westgate Resorts. Our family stayed here, like many do, as part of a time share presentation agreement. It is a nicely kept gated community. I signed up with them and received 2 nites lodging at a very reasonable rate and also received 2 free 2 day adult silver dollar city passes and a bonus free getaaway package to use at a future date. That said, our accomodations were merely adequate. We had a 2 queen bed room in one of the "out" buildings (#200), and it was outdated and worn looking. The beds were comfortable, the linens and towels felt nice. The bathroom was dated and the shower had virtually NO power to it. It was also, as I had read from other reviews prior to our visit, very noisy. The a/c worked ok but was noisy, and exterior noises were very prevelant (no rooms have interior corridors). There was no complimentary breakfast, only free (very good) coffee in the main building.. The property itself was very nice...two nice swimming pools, a shuffle board court, a half basketball court, and nice walkways, all well groomed and pleasant. The staff dress (purposefully I'm sure) in "National Park looking" clothing/uniforms. The property is up on a hill with lots of privately owned time share cabins. The check in procedure took way too much time as there were not enough clerks operating the desk. Our timeshare presentation was fine- no complaints except that at the end the "closing guy" was a bit pushy. When I finally laid down the law that we were not buying and that our time was up, they quit and we were free to enjoy our stay. I would cautiously recommend this property. They are expanding and it seems to have a bright future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely filthy 2 bedroom cabin”
Reviews.Author: mumsie2u
Reviews.Content: We are here for a week on an RCI exchange. We own a Hilton Grand Vacations Club timeshare and this is not even close to the same class of accommodation as any of the HGVC's. Our 2 bedroom cabin does have 2 king beds, but they are very old beds with old linens. The carpet in the living room and bedrooms is so dirty that our feet are black immediately if we walk without shoes. The "master bath" is so small with a 15 watt lightbulb that if you must stradle the toilet to open the door. The drawers in the master bedroom are taped together with duct tape! The second bedroom (the lock off) is better than the master but not by much. The kitchen has an old stove and the burners are either high or low. There's no middle temperature. The floor was very sticky when we checked in. The washer and dryer are the high points of this cabin. They appear to be new. There is generally a level of overall filth. The return grate on the wall is caked with grease and dust. The screened in porch is also a high point. It is nice. Would we stay here again or recommend this place. No way!

Reviews.Title: “Pass it by”
Reviews.Author: nongo84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights after purchasing a mini-vacation package directly from Westgate after doing a sales tour of their property. We had multiple problems with both reservation and check-in, and were passed on to at least five different people at check-in before we found someone that was able to solve the problem. The suite we stayed in was much, much older and of course not as nice as the suite we were originally shown at the time of purchase. The poor quality of the rooms and the cleanliness of them really made this a disappointing stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Blast!”
Reviews.Author: cheallefromtexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for our Band Trip. We checked in on Friday the 16 and left Monday the 20th. The rooms were nice, at least had a microwave and fridge. The property is very pretty, great walking trails. We had a fun-filled 2 days and all the kids really enjoyed it. A must for any visit to Branson is the Titanic museum it is so special, and the Riverboat show is awesome, but the most two favorite things were, The Haygoods show and Silver Park City. But the favorite was The Haygoods. Their show is a must!!!!! So much talent in that family!! The only complaint I have on the resort is some of our kids rooms were at the back of building 1 and just walking upstairs in their rooms some people would complain to management. But overall we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: den&holly
Reviews.Content: We booked our week via RCI on the extra vacations promotion. We have a timeshare in Cancun (through Raintree Vacations) and have an RCI affiliation. We had a 2 bedroom condo, A & B side in one of the older condo buildings. This resort has hotel units, older and new condo buildings, and log cabins. Our unit was downstairs (the resort is set on a hillside), the upstairs units have the loft bedroom. Check in was very quick and we were given a map of the resort and a guest pass for the local grocery store (nice touch!). What they didn't do is tell us where anything in the resort was located. We declined the 'tour' because we already had 10 shows to see during the week. Using the map we found the activities building and checked it out. Indoor pool and small exercise building. There are 2 outdoor pools open in the warm season and an outdoor hottub open year round (small 4 person kind). There is no hottub at the indoor pool!? The resort is in the process of building a pizzeria/store which should be open this summer. There is a playground, but no nature trail. It is being used as a construction access road. The location of this resort makes it conventient to get to the shows and shopping in Branson without being in the traffic on hwy 76. The drawback is there is nothing within walking distance. You will need to drive everywhere - including to the activities bldg unless you get lucky with your unit. The condo was well appointed with washer, dryer, VHS & DVD player, a stereo and kitchen appliances/utensils. The only thing we missed was a wine opener. There are 3 winerys (tasting stores really) in Branson and the unit had wine glasses, just no way to open the bottles! We bought one at Wal-mart and will keep it in the suitcase for future trips. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ybba
Reviews.Content: we have not stayed at any of the west gate resorts but its not from trying, if i was any one enterested in booking a cabin or condo don't even waste your time. we went through the tour 1 year ago and they did an get job in selling us a condo for the next year. I called for a reservation in February to go in August, for a 4 day getaway with my family and they told us that there were no openings in the mouths of July or august. we have been coming to Branson for the last 12 years on the same weekend and this the first time that i have had problems with getting a reservation. we paid way to much up front to stay at the west gate resort, when we could have went down the road and got in a nice motel for half the money, that i cant even use or get back. so if your going on a tour with this resort, Please think about what i have said and you might want to say no before they get into the buying, but all means take there free tickets its worth the 90 minutes to go to the free shows.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravelinWill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this location with my parents on a RCI Exchange. We had one of the three "bedroom" cabins. The staff was all fairly friendly, there were a couple though that were friendly but not quite competent. Overall they were all doing everything they could to meet our needs. The facilities were a mixed bag. One of the bedrooms lacked bedding as though house cleaning got interrupted in the middle of the job there. The cabin was odd. there was basically a two bedroom with an adjoining one bedroom unit, kind of like the two motel rooms that join. Two of the bedrooms were down stairs, and the upstairs was a loft not a bedroom, there were no walls for any privacy, there was merely stairs and a rail that separated it at all. It would have been ok, but the downstairs bedrooms were actually quite cold so we stayed up there because it was warmer. Aside from that the facilities were fairly well clean and well kept. They did have three great bathrooms that were large and spacious and featured a Jacuzzi bath tub. Amenities are another story, Internet was in all the rooms but it was pay to play an having problems at that. There was a pool and hot tub, however you would have to walk or drive a goodly bit to get to either of them. Overall I might return again, if your looking for a place to lay your head between shows you probably will not be disappointed and there is definitely a scenic view on your back porch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Cabin”
Reviews.Author: TXSoonerGal
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom cabin (A9) through vbro.com from a private owner at this resort for $115 a night. We checked in today, and it is absolutely amazing! The resort is close and convenient to everything, and it is absolutely beautiful! It is a very well-cared for property. The cabin we booked is incredible! It has a stone fireplace, a nice king bed, and nice bathroom, a great screen porch overlooking the hills, and a fully stocked kitchen. It is truly beautiful and cozy--much better than a hotel room. It was worth the cost for us because it had a bed for me and a couch bed for my boyfriend, and 2 hotel rooms would have been a similar price! Consider booking from a private owner through a site like vbro.com--I'm guessing you will get a better price and a nicer cabin.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property”
Reviews.Author: smc21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the studio room while on vacation. It was much nicer than I imagined. I confused the studio room with the hotel room. It is very spacious and has a half kitchen. The bathroom was very large and nice. It felt more like a condo than a hotel room. The grounds are kept very nice and there are beautiful ducks in the ponds. It is peaceful and quiet. The only thing that really bothered my husband and I was the fact that we had to pay for the internet. We used the business center, which is free in most hotels and resorts and it was $1 for every 5 minutes. If you bring your own laptop you can plug in for free, but there is also a charge to print. It did have a nice pool and other nice amenities, but for some reason the internet thing really bothered us. The indoor pool is nice and the fitness center is decent. I just think that it should offer more for a "5 star resort." They do have free coffee in the lobby,but they only have generic cream and sugar, and no other sweetners or flavors, that's not what I am accustomed to for a 5 star timeshare. We actually owned there for a period of time, but I do not recommend it at all, because with Westgate there are too many stipulations and charges. It was a Very nice property and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice timeshare resort but thn walls”
Reviews.Author: dougp26364
Reviews.Content: Westgate Branson Woods is a timeshare resort with a mix of available units including very cheap hotel rooms. Generally speaking, guests staying on preview packages will be assigned to a hotel room that isn't much better than a motel 6 room. Several years ago we had the unpleasant experience of staying in one of those hotel rooms on a preview package. This stay was an exchange booked through Interval International and we were assigned the one bedroom unit we had exchanged for. This was a very large one bedroom unit by timeshare standards and even had a seperate dining room rather than putthing the dining table and chairs between the kitchen and living area. The unit was clean with good furnishings. The unit had a full kitchen that was well stocked with a full size refigerator, full stove, dishwasher and garbage disposal. The living room had a fireplace with fake logs (not gas logs but plastic with a yellow/orange light behind them, sofa sleeper, two chairs and ceiling fan and good size (no big screen) TV. The bedroom had a king size bed that was reasonably comfortable and smaller TV. The bathroom had dual vanities and a nice jetted bathtub/shower combination. The unit was spottless from top to bottom. The grounds are pretty spread out but most amenities are located around the club house and by the new tower that's recently been built. The pool is nice but nothing to write home about. The second pool was very basic and just your standard rectangular pool. The hot tub was, IMO, a joke. I have a much nicer hot tub/spa at home. In the morning the water was clear but by early afternoon is was murky with all the suntan lotion in it. The fitness center is far to small for a resort of this size with only 3 treadmills, one eliptical and one stationary bike. There's also two pavilions and four nice gas grills. I saw a few older charcole grills scattered around the resort grounds as well. Our only complaint is that we were able to hear every footstep of the people in the unit above us and that we could hear even regular conversation of the people in the studio unit next to us. Timeshare resorts often have two bedroom units that can be split (locked-off) into a one bedroom and a studio unit. We could easily hear the couples conversations in the unit next to us. This makes it not an attractive resort for us to stay in during the busy summer months. Perhaps we'd stay here again in the spring or fall when children (who run and yell) are at a minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: HayBray
Reviews.Content: Our family booked our reservations (with confirmation numbers) at least a year in advance, however, upon arrival, they told us they didn't have our units available. We were staying here for a biennial family reunion that lasts for several days and had travelled by car from Michigan. We had reserved a 2 and 3 bedroom cabin. They could not fulfill the 3-bedroom, and thought 3 individual hotel rooms would be sufficient. [Mind you, we were here for a family reunion where cooking for potlucks are necessary...and they offered no discount in our pricing either.] As a result, we let my mother and grandmother take our 2 bedroom unit, while we found off-site accommodations away from the family we drove 700 miles to visit. The cabin was dark, musty, worn, and never felt clean. Our fears and observations were confirmed by comments in the guest book regarding brown recluse spiders. The screened porch was torn so we felt compelled to stay inside when at the unit. Sadly, we were NOT the only family members to experience these problems with reservations or accommodations. Despite its ideal outward appearance and location, I would never go back to this location under any circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems to list them all”
Reviews.Author: tacy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westgate Branson Woods for a family reunion. The property is attractive and the swimming pool is nice. But that's about all one can say good about the place. Here are some of the problems we and others in our party experienced: long lines and clueless clerks at check-in (they couldn't find our reservation, gave another group in our party a 1-bedroom cabin even though a 2-bedroom had been booked, etc.); clueless "concierge" who seemed to just be there to sell tickets and knew about nothing else; no room service both days of our stay (e.g., no clean towels, no beds made, no garbage removed); scalding hot water instantly out of the tap and hot/cold faucets reversed (a 5-year-old boy in our party was scalded by the hot water that came out of the "cold" faucet; he cried for 10 minutes from the burn); one group in our party with a three-night reservation rudely kicked out after two because the resort got the reservation wrong--they were able to stay the third night but had to "re-book" it at full rack rate; one group in our party trying to call others (you can't ring another room directly--have to go through a desk clerk) and told on two different times the parties had checked out (they hadn't); and more. I wouldn't recommend the place until reviews show these types of problems have been fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: ballers
Reviews.Content: We thought it would be a nice place to stay with our kids the sales pitch you get and the tour you take are far from the real thing. They ended up putting us 2 adults 2 kids in a studio which we never toured didn't even know they had one a studio had 1 kings size bed a table for 2 the bathtub was so small youo can not even cross your legs in it our 5 yr old could lay down in it and touch one end to the other with no extra room. we ask for a roll away bed but because we had a studio NO thats a fire hazard we actually left a day early and stayed somewhere else the sales person tried to get us to buy a timeshare and wanted us to wait on feeding our kids so he could still try to throw another pitch our way no thanks we wont buy nor stay with Westgate ever not even for free! Whoever stays with them get all the details up front and if you need to change dates even one day after the 30 day mark thats $100. almost everything that needs to be changed is a $100.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: HammondBadvacation
Reviews.Content: First of all, we expected better accomodations than a MOTEL room. It took both hands to turn on the faucet. The toilet seat was loose and each of us almost fell off of it !!!!!!!!!! The black lady with the sales pitch, got down right nasty and rude. Bit my tongue several times............wanted to tell her where to shove the TIMESHARES.

Reviews.Title: “Plastic Glasses and Motel Rooms”
Reviews.Author: GrandDi
Reviews.Content: A horrible vacation. My reservation said hotel but it was actulaly a motel that was old and outfront had grease spots. Where they took us on the tour was nice and Itold them that if they wanted us to buy they should give us the experience of the resort part instead of what one of the salemen said "you get what you pay for". This was while they were trying to sell me the package. If they are not truthful when booking how can they be truthful when they want you to purchase. Two things to look out for: When you book your tour time they will not let you change it and the interest rate to purchaes is 17.99 percent. It certainly was not the Disney Experience and I won't go back there. One good note the girl at the ticket counter there was great and it was not a pressure to purchase a time share. i told them I was not interested and they offered several different packages and sent several people over but I kept saying I was not interested.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches and High Pressure Sales tactics”
Reviews.Author: msmollybygolly
Reviews.Content: We are owners at Westgate Branson Woods. We bought from the original builders. Since Westgate has taken over, we have seen many changes including high pressure selling tactics and at our last visit, the place had cockroaches. Upon checking in, we were invited to move to another desk to sign up for a timeshare presentation before we were given a coupon book. We told them we were not interested in buying anymore timeshares; they said in order to receive the coupon book (which had always been given to us upon arrival) we had to sign up for the presentation. We mulled it over and then signed up for the presentation at the clubhouse the next morning. The coupon book was held back until they knew we would show up for the meeting. The first thing we found in our condo were cockroaches. Called the desk; they sent someone over to spray. Being owners of rental properties, we know the importance of spraying your properties. We knew if our Condo had cockroaches; the others did too. Not only do you have the inconvenience of having the roaches while your there, they sometimes have a way of getting into your items that you take home. The next morning we showed up for our timeshare meeting only to be met with a high pressure salesperson. We told her we had complaints about the high pressure check-in and the roaches. She carefully wrote all our complaints down, assured us she would give our detailed complaints to the proper people. We then listened to the sales pitch; she finally brought in a higher up person for a last attempt pitch to get us to buy. We didn't! Branson is a beautiful place; the shows are wonderful including the people. Our week proceeded along nicely until the roaches showed up again. We just threw in the towel and left early. We did not stop at the front desk, because the club house personnel told us they would turn in our complaints to the responsible person. Upon returning home, my husband phoned westgate to inquire about our complaints and how they were being handled. We thought we should have been compensated in some manner. After investgating our complaints, the woman indeed found who our representative was that day, but no complaints had ever been turned in. Our guess is after we finished listening to their sales pitch, our complaints were crumpled up and thrown in the nearest trash can. It turned out to be our word against theirs. The only thing they confirmed was our room had been sprayed upon our arrival. They also said we should have complained when we left early; but being assured by Westgate's representative that she would get our complaints to the responsible people, we believed it would be reviewed through her notes. Westgate indicates their properties are 5 star; most of them are only listed as actually 3 star. All in all, it was not what I want to ever experience again!! Hindsight is the best learning experience; don't buy timeshares; by the time you pay all the extra costs, you never come out ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Worst vacation of my life. 30 problems total! DON"T VACATION HERE!”
Reviews.Author: beadworkartist_amy
Reviews.Content: It took me five hours and 18 different individuals to get my room booked and our tickets purchased. We still had unanswered questions and discrepancies at 9:30 that night. The next day I spoke to a gentleman in the Florida corporate offices about all the problems, all the lies, all the conflicting information and details. He was hateful. When we arrived to a supposedly luxurious room with pillow soft beds we found instead a standard, run-of-the-mill type of hotel room. The beds hurt my back. We were supposedly going to rooms that were "all ground level" yet we had a room above us which apparently was hosting a stampeding elephants convention. There was no breakfast included with our room. Rather, we had to pay $4.50 EACH for an outside company who caters it. Our "discounted" tickets to Dixie Stampede placed us in the worst seats in the house where there was no room for your legs and narrow bench seats. Everybody else had comfortable seating! Oh, and you have to eat with your hands there. Not good for my manicure, so I didn't eat at all. This was one of those timeshare vacation packages where you have to sit though a presentation. Our 90 min. presentation lasted 3 1/2 hours! Only when I literally got up and walked out did it end. One thing after another happened to us this whole trip. Every time we turned around there was yet another negative surprise. We left early, not staying for the final night. Upon check out I find out that they charge you 75 cents per LOCAL CALL that you make! When I questioned this the front desk clerk said "Oh, well, the information on the phone charges are listed in your information book". That is, the information folder that nobody ever bothers to look at and of which by the way was in the drawer under the phone! In total, there were 31 different problems which occurred over a three day period! I could spend all day writing out the novel of my nightmare-ish vacation, but this will do. Just please, for the love of God, do NOT even blink at this resort. They lie, lie, lie, craftily and conveniently neglect to disclose information to you, then when you ask questions or complain they treat you like dirt, like an idiot, or like you are trying to pull one over on them!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort!”
Reviews.Author: sr06
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about how wonderful our stay was at this resort. The staff was wonderful. The suite was beautiful and very clean. The outdoor pool was lovely and clean. The landscaping was beautiful. Every evening there was free entertainment in the clubhouse except Tues. which had a $6.00 dinner but it also included 2 hrs of entertainment from the different shows in town along with the dinner. The Duttons were amazing, Jim Owen was very funny but also a award winning songwriter. A new group (the Knudson's) were very entertaining. This was just a few of the entertainers. My husband and I really enjoyed The Pavilion Pickers on Wed. night. Very talented "good ole country". Gary Welsch on Sun.pm.-pleasant, humerous and good country singer. Tues pm-Incredible John Fullerton, musician and display of 500 Sons of Pioneers history and collectibles. We were busy and couldn't attend the Karoke on Thur. or the Block party on Fri. There were ongoing free activities everyday OF ALL KINDS! Plus-Basketball court, shuffleboard, real sand volleyball court, ping-pong. The concierge got us great seats at the shows.

Reviews.Title: “What a crap hole!”
Reviews.Author: gawmson
Reviews.Content: Where to start? There were rollie-pollie bugs crawling out of the bathroom tiles. It took 45-minutes to check in because our room still wasn't ready at 6:00 in the afternoon and they refused to upgrade us. The room itself had paper-thin walls, smelled like mold, had one small window that provided no natural light, and there was no room service in the morning; this was a suite! The next morning room service did come, but didn't bring clean towels or toilet paper. Upon checkout, we had an extra $5 charge for "The Westgate Foundation Dispute" whatever the hell that is. That's minor compared to the $110 overcharge that resulted from paying the first night before booking the room and then them charging us again for it when we checked out. The phone service to fix the problem was terrible. The bill itself didn't have the phone number. The number on the charge-card receipt was for the corporate offices, they couldn't help me. They redirected me to a local number, but it wasn't the hotel. They said I had to call the hotel directly. The number they gave me was wrong. I had to get on-line to find the right number. At first it was busy. When I did finally get through they said it was after hours. It was 11:30am on a Tuesday. I still haven't gotten my money back.

HotelInfo.Name: Westgate Branson Woods
HotelInfo.Address: 2201 Roark Valley Road, Branson, MO 65616
